intro: Sclerochorton haussknechtii, commonly known as the Hausknecht's spurge, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often spiny leaves and yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its latex is toxic, which serves as a defense mechanism against herbivores. Sclerochorton haussknechtii is often found in open, sunny habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
